intro: Pimelea bicolor, commonly known as the yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry forests, preferring well-drained soils. It has small, narrow leaves and produces capsules that contain numerous seeds. Pimelea bicolor is also known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators.
